paper_abstract: We consider several random graph models based on k-trees, which can be generated by applying the probabilistic growth rules uniform attachment, preferential attachment, or a saturation-rule, respectively, but which also can be described in a combinatorial way. For all of these models we study the number of ancestors and the number of descendants of nodes in the graph by carrying out a precise analysis which leads to exact and limiting distributional results. (c) 2014 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. Random Struct. Alg. 44, 465-489, 2014
paper_title: Ancestors and Descendants in Evolving k-Tree Models
